Stem: Upright or semi-upright, relatively robust, hairless. Filled with a light pith that helps flotation.
Leaves: Elongated blades 10-45 cm long, clasping around stem, with pointed tips. Mostly hairless except sometimes towards base. Small membranous flap at join (ligule).
Flowers: Dense, long 10-50 cm flower spike with large number of spikelets.
FruitSeeds: Small oval shaped seeds which remain enclosed in bracts when they fall.
DistinguishingFeatures: Stem-clasping leaf bases distinguish from native *Hymenachne* species.
Impacts: Blocks and chokes waterways, reduces habitat for native fauna, reduces sugarcane quality significantly.

Photos.Caption: Leaf bases can wrap around stem
